Title: Interest Rates Fall, but Central Banks Are No Longer in Lock Step
Summary: Officials in some countries started cutting rates last year, but others, including those in Europe and the United States, have taken a more cautious approach.

Title: After Fed Cuts Rates, Biden Claims Credit for Economy’s Strength
Summary: The president said he was not declaring victory over inflation, but marking a pivot point for the recovery from pandemic recession.

Title: How Inflation and High Interest Rates Have Changed the Economy
Summary: As inflation cools and the Federal Reserve cuts rates, an era of economic upheaval is coming to a close, but not without lingering marks.

Title: Boeing to Begin Temporary Layoffs Due to Strike
Summary: The aerospace giant said it would temporarily lay off tens of thousands of employees to stem losses from a walkout by the machinists’ union.

Title: What Trump Has Said About Interest Rates, and Why It Matters
Summary: He has suggested that presidents should “have a say” on interest rates, though he later walked the comment back.

Title: Fed’s Interest Rate Cut Would Cap a Winning Streak for Harris and Biden on Prices
Summary: Improved data on borrowing costs and price growth has buoyed consumers, but it might be coming too late to significantly affect the presidential race.

Title: Fed Cuts Interest Rates for First Time in Four Years
Summary: Fed officials kicked off rate cuts with a half-point reduction, confident that inflation is cooling and eager to keep the job market strong.

Title: How the Fed Cutting Interest Rates Affects Stocks, Banks and More
Summary: For corporate America, this week’s expected interest rate cut carries risks along with rewards.

Title: How SMIC, China’s Semiconductor Champion, Landed in the Heart of a Tech War
Summary: Efforts by the Beijing-backed Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corporation, or SMIC, to break through innovation barriers have landed it in a geopolitical tech battle.
